{{Notability|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox software | name = OpenOffice.org Draw | logo = [[File:OOoDraw.png|52px]] | screenshot = [[File:OpenOffice.org Draw.png|Screenshot of OpenOffice.org Draw|250px]] | caption = OpenOffice.org Draw 3.0.0 | collapsible = | developer = [[Oracle Corporation]] | status = Active | latest release version = 3.3 | latest release date = {{Release date and age|2011|01|25}} | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[Mac OS X]]
[[Linux]]
[[Berkeley Software Distribution|BSD]]
[[Unix]] | platform = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = Drawing | license = [[GNU Lesser General Public License]] | website = [http://www.openoffice.org/product/draw.html www.openoffice.org] }} [[File:OOo Draw Screenshot.png|right|thumb|250px]] {{Commons category}} '''OpenOffice.org Draw''' is a [[vector graphics editor]] and is part of the [[OpenOffice.org]] [[office suite]]. It features "connectors" between shapes, which are available in a range of line styles and facilitate building drawings such as [[flowchart]]. It also includes many features found in [[desktop publishing]] software. OpenOffice.org users can also install the [[Open Clip Art Library]], which adds an extensive gallery of flags, logos, icons and banners for general presentation and drawing projects. In particular, [[Linux distribution]]s [[Debian]] and [[Ubuntu Linux|Ubuntu]] have provided ready-to-use ''openclipart'' packages for easy download and install from their online software repositories. Released under the terms of the [[GNU Lesser General Public Licence]], Draw is [[free software]]. == SVG support status == Currently OpenOffice.org supports exporting to [[Scalable Vector Graphics|SVG]] format officially, though with some limitations to be resolved[http://graphics.openoffice.org/svg/svg.htm graphics: openoffice.org : graphics : chart project]. The SVG import filter[http://wiki.services.openoffice.org/wiki/SVG_Import_Filter SVG Import Filter - OpenOffice.org Wiki], however, is still under development and requires the [[Java Runtime Environment]] to be installed. It is anticipated that as SVG and SVG filters evolve, users will be able to use Draw to edit the large scale collection of SVG samples from Open Clip Art Library. == See also == {{Portal|Free software}} * [[List of vector graphics editors]] * [[Comparison of vector graphics editors]] * [[Scalable Vector Graphics]] * [[Open Clip Art Library]] * [[Comparison of office suites]] ==References== How-to: Get to Grips with OpenOffice.org Draw] (PDF, free download from [http://documentation.openoffice.org/HOW_TO/index.html official How-tos]) * [http://www.cluesheets.com/OO2DrawCS.pdf Sample clipart], offers public domain images in ODG & SVG format, directly usable by openoffice {{Vector graphics editors}} {{OpenOffice.org}} {{Sun Microsystems}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Openoffice.Org Draw}}
